tit.e: The Battle of Subushi (a battle fought between the Imperial Army and Emishi in Rikuchu Province in Nara period)
The Battle of Subushi (a battle fought between the Imperial Army and Emishi in Rikuchu Province in Nara period)

sen.j: 巣伏の戦い（すぶしのたたかい）は奈良時代に東北地方（後の陸中国）で発生した、朝廷軍と蝦夷による戦闘である。
sen.e: Battle of Subushi is a battle fought in Rikuchu Province of Tohoku region between the Imperial army and Ezo in the Nara period.

The Battle of Subushi was a battle between the Imperial army and Emishi (natives of the Japanese islands of Hokkaido and northern Honshu that opposed and resisted the rule of the Japanese Emperors) occurred in Tohoku region (later Rikuchu Province) in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 読み、表現を変えました。
sen.e: The Battle of Subushi was a battle between the Imperial army and Emishi (natives of the Japanese islands of Hokkaido and northern Honshu that opposed and resisted the rule of the Japanese Emperors) occurred in Tohoku region (later Rikuchu Province) in the Nara period.

sen.j: 788年（延暦7年）、紀古佐美が征東将軍に任じられ、翌789年（延暦8年）、朝廷軍を率いて蝦夷征討へ赴く。
sen.e: In 788 KI no Kosami was appointed to the position of the commander for the expedition to subjugate indigenous inhabitants in eastern Japan; in the following year of 789, he went to eastern Japan leading Imperial army, and proceeded to subjugate indigenous inhabitants there.
KI no Kosami who was appointed to the position ofseito shogun (literally, "general who subdues the eastern barbarians") in 788 led the Imperial army to conquer the Emishi in the following year, 789.
KI no Kosami who was appointed to the position ofseito shogun (literally, "general who subdues the eastern barbarians") in 788 led the Imperial army to conquer the Emishi in the following year, 789.

sen.j: 陸奥へ達した朝廷軍は、蝦夷側の首領阿弖流爲の根拠地である胆沢の入り口にあたる衣川村に軍を駐屯させて日を重ねていたが、5月末に桓武天皇の叱責を受けて行動を起こした。
sen.e: The Imperial army reached Mutsu Province and made themselves to stay in Koromogawa Village which was located at the entrance of the Isawa and which was a base of chieftain Aterui of the Ezo side, and the army stayed there without getting into any fight with the opponent; finally scolded by the Emperor Kammu the army took action at the end of May.

The Imperial army reached Mutsu Province and spent several days staying in Koromogawa Village at the entrance of the Isawa where the chieftain Aterui of the Emishi side was based, then after the Emperor Kanmu's reprimand, it took action at the end of June.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直し、スペル、表現を変えました。
sen.e: The Imperial army reached Mutsu Province and spent several days staying in Koromogawa Village at the entrance of the Isawa where the chieftain Aterui of the Emishi side was based, then after the Emperor Kanmu's reprimand, it took action at the end of June.

sen.j: 北上川の西に3箇所に分かれて駐屯していた朝廷軍のうち、中軍と後軍の4000が川を渡って東岸を進んだ。
sen.e: Before getting into action the Imperial army was stayed at the west of the Kitakami-ga River consisting of three groups of the front, middle, and back; among these three groups 4000 soldiers who belong to the middle group and the back group crossed the Kitakami-gawa River; after crossing they moved ahead along the east coast of the Kitakami-gawa River.
From the Imperial army having stayed in three places in the west of the Kitakami-gawa River, 4000 soldiers of the middle and rear troops crossed the river to the east bank.
sen.cmt: スペル、表現を変えました。
sen.e: From the Imperial army having stayed in three places in the west of the Kitakami-gawa River, 4000 soldiers of the middle and rear troops crossed the river to the east bank.

sen.j: この主力軍は、阿弖流爲の居のあたりで前方に蝦夷軍約300を見て交戦した。
sen.e: These main armed forces saw about 300 Ezo force forward in an area where the residence of Aterui is located and they fought each other.
These main armed forces saw and fought about 300 Emishi force forward in an area where the residence of Aterui was located.
These main armed forces saw and fought about 300 Emishi force forward in an area where the residence of Aterui was located.

sen.j: 当初は優勢で、朝廷軍は敵を追って巣伏村に至った。
sen.e: In the beginning the Imperial army was in the lead; and in pursuit of their enemy, the Imperial army reached Subushi Village.
In the beginning the Imperial army was in the lead to reach Subushi Village chasing the enemy.
In the beginning the Imperial army was in the lead to reach Subushi Village chasing the enemy.

sen.j: そこで前軍と合流しようと考えたが、前軍は蝦夷軍に阻まれて渡河できなかった。
sen.e: Thereupon, the main forces tried to join with the front group; however, being blocked by the Ezo forces, the front group was not able to cross the Kitakami-ga River.
Thereupon, the main forces tried to join with the front troop which, however, was not able to cross the river being blocked by the Emishi forces.
Thereupon, the main forces tried to join with the front troop which, however, was not able to cross the river being blocked by the Emishi forces.

sen.j: その時、蝦夷側に約800が加わって反撃に転じ、更に東山から蝦夷軍約400が現れて後方を塞いだ。
sen.e: At this time about 800 soldiers of Ezo side joined the existing 300 soldiers and they turned for a counterattack; furthermore, another 400 soldiers appeared from Mt.Higashi and blocked the rear.
On this occasion, about 800 soldiers were joined with the Emishi side and about 400 additional soldiers of the Emishi appeared from Mt. Higashi to block the rear.
On this occasion, about 800 soldiers were joined with the Emishi side and about 400 additional soldiers of the Emishi appeared from Mt. Higashi to block the rear.

sen.j: 朝廷軍は壊走し、別将の丈部善理ら戦死者25人、矢にあたる者245人、川で溺死する者1036人、裸身で泳ぎ来る者1257人の損害を出した。
sen.e: The imperial army was completely defeated; soldiers killed in action were 25 including an officer HATSUSEBE no Zenri, soldiers who were hit by arrow were 245, soldiers who drowned in the river were 1036; soldiers who swam with naked body to cross the river were 1257; as these numbers show, the damage the Imperial army received was devastating.
The Imperial army routed and suffered a loss of 25 soldiers killed including an officer HATSUSEBE no Zenri, 245 hit by arrow, 1036 drowned in the river, and 1257 naked to cross the river.
The Imperial army routed and suffered a loss of 25 soldiers killed including an officer HATSUSEBE no Zenri, 245 hit by arrow, 1036 drowned in the river, and 1257 naked to cross the river.

sen.j: この敗戦で、紀古佐美の遠征は失敗に終わった。
sen.e: With this defeat, the expedition of KI no Kosami ended in failure.
With this defeat, the expedition of KI no Kosami ended in failure.
With this defeat, the expedition of KI no Kosami ended in failure.

sen.j: 5月末か6月初めに起こったこの戦いは、寡兵をもって大兵を破ること著しいもので、鮮やかに決まった戦術は日本古代史に類例がない。
sen.e: This battle which occurred at the end of May or at the beginning of June was the battle in which small number of soldiers defeated the large number of the opposing force; the strategy employed by this army is remarkable; there is no such case in the history of ancient Japan.

The battle occurred at the end of June or at the beginning of July was tactically remarkable that small number of soldiers defeated the large number and no other battle for this kind was found in the history of ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直し表現を変えました。
sen.e: The battle occurred at the end of June or at the beginning of July was tactically remarkable that small number of soldiers defeated the large number and no other battle for this kind was found in the history of ancient Japan.

sen.j: 再度の征討軍として、大伴弟麻呂と坂上田村麻呂の遠征軍が編成されたが、その交戦については詳細が伝わらない。
sen.e: As the second subjugation force, the expedition force of OTOMO no Otomaro and SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro was organized, but the details about this war are not handed down.
As the second subjugation force, the expedition force of OTOMO no Otomaro and SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro was organized, but the details about how they engaged are not handed down.
